line.comment: * Task 0.
* This fleet is the only one that can claim and conquer sectors.
* Does not conquer Protectorates.
* Does not conquer Xenon sectors.
* Needs Ad. Sat coverage.
* Conquers Dejure sectors in priority, then look for the most valuable sector.
* If the starting option "deep strike" is on, Battle Groups are not limited to border sectors.
* To conquer a sector, all stations of the owner must be destroyed. Other stations are left intact.
* When a sector is targetted (Ad.Sat check), the Battle Group goes to the nearest [OWNER] sector, THEN if its force is stronger (Ad.Sat check), it claims the sector and go there to conquer it...
* ... if it's not strong enough, it looks for other sectors.
* Other Battle Groups will reinforce already claimed sectors if the hostile ships are too strong (ie. initiative is not in favour of on-site Battle Groups anymore).
* Target priority: Huge Ships, Big Ships, Factories, Outpost.
* do if [NULL]-> call script 'Mayhem.Squadron.SwitchLeaderIfNeeded' : squadron=[THIS]
* continue
* Coordinated Invasions
* preparation phase
* attack phase
* Zero Hour AI: -1=full defense ; 0=cautious ; 1=neutral (vanilla Mayhem 3) ; 2=confident ; 3=reckless
* Protector AI
* first try up to 4 jumps from our current location (here we don't tether to the homebase because we want them to be able to roam the entire galaxy)
* after we have found and taken down enemies we can switch back to the short range search method
* if we couldn't find enemies with double search radius we must go somewhere else
* if we can't find any enemies within 4 jumps we must double our search radius
* small chance for a retreat to reach full strength
* on full defense mode we go escort our most powerful Rearguard squadron to create a powerful defensive fleet stack
* Attack enemies in current sector if we are claiming it.
* Huge ships.
* Big ships.
* $targets = [NULL]-> call script 'Mayhem.GetHostileShips' : sector=[SECTOR] race=[OWNER] ignoreCivilian=[TRUE] ignoreFighters=[TRUE] ignoreBigShips=[FALSE] maxdist=100000
* gosub AttackLastTarget:
* do if $target-> exists
* goto label Attack:
* Factories.
* Outpost.
* Pirate base. (disabled in Zero Hour)
* $target = find station: sector=[SECTOR] class or type={Pirates Pirate Base (DOCK_PIRATES)} race=[Pirates] flags=null refobj=null maxdist=null maxnum=99 refpos=null
* do if $target-> exists
* goto label Attack:
* Conquering is managed in !station.signal.killed (and Mayhem.Claim).
* But we make sure, because in some cases, it won't work.
* Global Alliance or Protector AI allows unlimited range invasions against the Xenon!
* Sort sectors by [OWNER] claimed sectors in need, dejure and value.
* ZH agressive factions can always deep strike. Global Alliance enabled unlimited deep strike for everyone
* if !$isGalaxyExpansionNone OR ($isGalaxyExpansionNone AND $playtime > 86400)
* 3.15: Wait between two claims. Zero Hour: no!
* $claimDelayTime = [THIS]-> get local variable: name='mayhem_claimDelayTime'
* if $claimDelayTime
* $claimDelay = get global variable: name='mayhem_claimDelay'
* do if $playtime - $claimDelayTime < $claimDelay
* goto label Attack:
* end
* end
* Zero Hour: defensive factions always want completion
* Zero Hour: if you want more forces you should actually go get them and not wait endlessly
* goto label Attack:
* during Exodus we cannot invade Xenons if that would expand our territory towards the OCV portal
* during the Xenon Crisis we need to stay a bit away from the portal until it is blockaded (this gets handled by special CIs)
* Galactic Protector likes to invade Xenon
* during the Xenon Crisis we want to carpet siege the Xenon quicker than usual. High chance to not support other Battlegroups and spread more sector claims instead.
* Galactic Protector does the same but much rarer
* We need to help invading another sector.
* If we have Terraformer invaders, or if we are invaded, we go in priority.
* ** Zero Hour: we don't do this if we are confident or reckless.
* we also don't do it during the Global Alliance because other special fleets already hunt the Terraformers down for us while we need to clear the Xenon sectors!
* ZH: reckless factions have +1 range
* during the Xenon Crisis (or Galactic Protector) we have unlimited range but don't prefer our dejures (to shake things up a bit our dejures might be
* held by someone else and this will cause more interesting war activity after the Crisis when we try to get them back)
* Prioritize Xenon and Unknown sectors.
* Look for the nearest safe sector to prepare for attack.
* during Zero Hour we don't go to a safe sector first. We throw everything against the Xenon!
* Attack enemy sector.
* high chance to abort the attack because you actually want peace. But not during a Coalition when targeting your shared enemy
* If there's no station, we move to the sector before claiming it (and potentially conquering it).
* If the sector was empty, or Unknown, it's best to stay in the area for a while.
* Zero Hour extends claim time based on jump distance
* if we run out of targets during the Xenon Crisis we don't switch homebase and just stay where we are. Eventually a CI will allow us to go closer to the OCV portal.

sval.val: Wait at %s in %s
Regrouping to %s in %s
Invading %s
Hunting Terraformers in %s
Regrouping to %s
Escorting %s
Regrouping to %s
Moving to %s
Moving to %s
Moving to %s
Attacking %s
Regrouping to %s
Defending %s
Task 0.
This fleet is the only one that can claim and conquer sectors.
Does not conquer Protectorates.
Does not conquer Xenon sectors.
Needs Ad. Sat coverage.
Conquers Dejure sectors in priority, then look for the most valuable sector.
If the starting option "deep strike" is on, Battle Groups are not limited to border sectors.
To conquer a sector, all stations of the owner must be destroyed. Other stations are left intact.
When a sector is targetted (Ad.Sat check), the Battle Group goes to the nearest [OWNER] sector, THEN if its force is stronger (Ad.Sat check), it claims the sector and go there to conquer it...
... if it's not strong enough, it looks for other sectors.
Other Battle Groups will reinforce already claimed sectors if the hostile ships are too strong (ie. initiative is not in favour of on-site Battle Groups anymore).
Target priority: Huge Ships, Big Ships, Factories, Outpost.
do if [NULL]-> call script 'Mayhem.Squadron.SwitchLeaderIfNeeded' : squadron=[THIS]
Coordinated Invasions
preparation phase
attack phase
Zero Hour AI: -1=full defense ; 0=cautious ; 1=neutral (vanilla Mayhem 3) ; 2=confident ; 3=reckless
Protector AI
first try up to 4 jumps from our current location (here we don't tether to the homebase because we want them to be able to roam the entire galaxy)
after we have found and taken down enemies we can switch back to the short range search method
if we couldn't find enemies with double search radius we must go somewhere else
if we can't find any enemies within 4 jumps we must double our search radius
small chance for a retreat to reach full strength
on full defense mode we go escort our most powerful Rearguard squadron to create a powerful defensive fleet stack
Attack enemies in current sector if we are claiming it.
Huge ships.
Big ships.
$targets = [NULL]-> call script 'Mayhem.GetHostileShips' : sector=[SECTOR] race=[OWNER] ignoreCivilian=[TRUE] ignoreFighters=[TRUE] ignoreBigShips=[FALSE] maxdist=100000
gosub AttackLastTarget:
do if $target-> exists
goto label Attack:
Pirate base. (disabled in Zero Hour)
$target = find station: sector=[SECTOR] class or type={Pirates Pirate Base (DOCK_PIRATES)} race=[Pirates] flags=null refobj=null maxdist=null maxnum=99 refpos=null
do if $target-> exists
goto label Attack:
Conquering is managed in !station.signal.killed (and Mayhem.Claim).
But we make sure, because in some cases, it won't work.
Global Alliance or Protector AI allows unlimited range invasions against the Xenon!
Sort sectors by [OWNER] claimed sectors in need, dejure and value.
ZH agressive factions can always deep strike. Global Alliance enabled unlimited deep strike for everyone
if !$isGalaxyExpansionNone OR ($isGalaxyExpansionNone AND $playtime > 86400)
3.15: Wait between two claims. Zero Hour: no!
$claimDelayTime = [THIS]-> get local variable: name='mayhem_claimDelayTime'
if $claimDelayTime
$claimDelay = get global variable: name='mayhem_claimDelay'
do if $playtime - $claimDelayTime < $claimDelay
goto label Attack:
Zero Hour: defensive factions always want completion
Zero Hour: if you want more forces you should actually go get them and not wait endlessly
goto label Attack:
during Exodus we cannot invade Xenons if that would expand our territory towards the OCV portal
during the Xenon Crisis we need to stay a bit away from the portal until it is blockaded (this gets handled by special CIs)
Galactic Protector likes to invade Xenon
during the Xenon Crisis we want to carpet siege the Xenon quicker than usual. High chance to not support other Battlegroups and spread more sector claims instead.
Galactic Protector does the same but much rarer
We need to help invading another sector.
If we have Terraformer invaders, or if we are invaded, we go in priority.
** Zero Hour: we don't do this if we are confident or reckless.
we also don't do it during the Global Alliance because other special fleets already hunt the Terraformers down for us while we need to clear the Xenon sectors!
ZH: reckless factions have +1 range
during the Xenon Crisis (or Galactic Protector) we have unlimited range but don't prefer our dejures (to shake things up a bit our dejures might be
held by someone else and this will cause more interesting war activity after the Crisis when we try to get them back)
Prioritize Xenon and Unknown sectors.
Look for the nearest safe sector to prepare for attack.
during Zero Hour we don't go to a safe sector first. We throw everything against the Xenon!
Attack enemy sector.
high chance to abort the attack because you actually want peace. But not during a Coalition when targeting your shared enemy
If there's no station, we move to the sector before claiming it (and potentially conquering it).
If the sector was empty, or Unknown, it's best to stay in the area for a while.
Zero Hour extends claim time based on jump distance
if we run out of targets during the Xenon Crisis we don't switch homebase and just stay where we are. Eventually a CI will allow us to go closer to the OCV portal.
